page.title: 12HOME LIFE IN WILLINGDON
page.content: Nearly all children have day outings with parents. A few never have a holiday away from home. More than half have a holiday in this country. Seaside holidays are less popular than countryside holidays. Most are self-catering. Playtime clothes are shorts or jeans and tee-shirt. Boys wear smart trousers and shirt for special occasions,girls a dress or skirt and blouse. 73% of homes have a daily newspaper, most popularly the Daily Mail. Three advertisers are delivered locally, free. Most people read a local weekly paper. 75% of homes belong to a library. 50% of children read 2 or 3 books a week. Most homes have two television sets, a video recorder and a music centre. ITV is the most popular channel. 40% always watch Breakfast Television. 20% never watch it.
